slide.title: EUS Diagnosis of Submucosal Lesions
slide.notes: Thank you chairman and distinguish guests. Frist of all I would like to express my sincere appreciation to my old friend prof Dong Wan seo and organize comittiie. It is great honor to have my presentation in front of you

slide.notesHtml: Thank you chairman and distinguish guests. Frist of all I would like to express my sincere appreciation to my old friend prof Dong Wan seo and organize comittiie. It is great honor to have my presentation in front of you
slide.text: EUS Diagnosis of Submucosal Lesions EUS Summit, September 9th, 2016 MITSUHIRO KIDA, MD, PhD Dept. of Gastroenterology Kitasato University Sagamihara, JAPAN

slide.title: Visualizing method for UGI
slide.notes: There are several visualizing method for Upper Gastrointestinal lesions such as water filling method , balloon method , conitinuous water filling method and jelly method
slide.notesNormalized: there are several visualizing method for upper gastrointestinal lesions such as water filling method , balloon method , conitinuous water filling method and jelly method
slide.notesHtml: There are several visualizing method for Upper Gastrointestinal lesions such as water filling method , balloon method , conitinuous water filling method and jelly method
slide.text: Visualizing method for UGI １、Water filling method for conventional EUS for probe with T-shaped connector ２、Balloon method for conventional EUS for lesions around cardia & fornix ３、Continuous water filling for Esophageal & duodenal lesions for probe with T-shaped connector ４、Jelly method for Esophageal lesions for probe with 2 channel endoscope

slide.title: Water filling method
slide.notes: This is water filling device, which is made by ourselves with pump. Dereaeted water should be warmed to 37 degree, otherwise cold water sitimulates perstalisis.
slide.notesNormalized: this is water filling device, which is made by ourselves with pump. dereaeted water should be warmed to 37 degree, otherwise cold water sitimulates perstalisis.
slide.notesHtml: This is water filling device, which is made by ourselves with pump. Dereaeted water should be warmed to 37 degree, otherwise cold water sitimulates perstalisis.
slide.text: Water filling method

slide.title: Water filling & Continuous water filling method With T-shaped connector
slide.titleNormalized: water filling & continuous water filling method with t-shaped connector
slide.notes: Using forward viewing endoscope with bigger channel such as 3.7 mm in diameter. We can insert probe and fill water too !
slide.notesNormalized: using forward viewing endoscope with bigger channel such as 3.7 mm in diameter. we can insert probe and fill water too !
slide.notesHtml: Using forward viewing endoscope with bigger channel such as 3.7 mm in diameter. We can insert probe and fill water too !
slide.text: Water filling & Continuous water filling method With T-shaped connector

slide.title: Rinse inside of the stomach at least one time !
slide.titleNormalized: rinse inside of the stomach at least one time !
slide.notes: In order to avoid the artifact of mucous, You should rinse with 100 – 200 ml of water inside of the stomach at least one time
slide.notesNormalized: in order to avoid the artifact of mucous, you should rinse with 100 – 200 ml of water inside of the stomach at least one time
slide.notesHtml: In order to avoid the artifact of mucous, You should rinse with 100 – 200 ml of water inside of the stomach at least one time
slide.text: Rinse inside of the stomach at least one time ! Before rinse After rinse

slide.title: Normal stomach wall by EUS
slide.notes: Using lower frequency, GI wall is detected 5 layer structure 1st & 2nd layer means mucosa, 3rd layer submucosa 4th proper muscle layer and 5th subserosa and serosa. Using high frequency, wecan detect muscularis mucosae and boder of inner and outer muscle
slide.notesNormalized: using lower frequency, gi wall is detected 5 layer structure 1st & 2nd layer means mucosa, 3rd layer submucosa 4th proper muscle layer and 5th subserosa and serosa. using high frequency, wecan detect muscularis mucosae and boder of inner and outer muscle
slide.notesHtml: Using lower frequency, GI wall is detected 5 layer structure 1st & 2nd layer means mucosa, 3rd layer submucosa 4th proper muscle layer and 5th subserosa and serosa. Using high frequency, wecan detect muscularis mucosae and boder of inner and outer muscle
slide.text: Normal stomach wall by EUS First layer （border echo） Second Layer Fourth Layer Third Layer Fifth Layer (border echo) { Mucosa Submucosa Proper Muscle Subserosa, Serosa } Third layer（border e.） Fourth layer Fifth Layer Sixth Layer Seventh layer (border e.) Eighth Layer Ninth layer (border echo Proper mucosa Musclaris mucosae Submucosa Inner muscle Connective tissue Subserosa, Serosa Outer Muscle First layer （border echo） Second Layer 7.5-12 MHz 12-20 MHz

slide.title: How to diagnose the originating layer
slide.titleNormalized: how to diagnose the originating layer
slide.notes: In order to diagnose originating layer, It is practicable to evaluate connection between SMT and normal structure
slide.notesNormalized: in order to diagnose originating layer, it is practicable to evaluate connection between smt and normal structure
slide.notesHtml: In order to diagnose originating layer, It is practicable to evaluate connection between SMT and normal structure
slide.text: How to diagnose the originating layer

slide.title: How to diagnose SMT by originating layer
slide.titleNormalized: how to diagnose smt by originating layer
slide.notes: Leiomyoma originate from 2nd layer , From 3rd layer Lipoma Lymphangioma, fibroma, From 4th layer GIST Leiomyoma, and schwannoma Ectopic pancreas and Glomus tumor originated from 3rd and 4th layer
slide.notesNormalized: leiomyoma originate from 2nd layer , from 3rd layer lipoma lymphangioma, fibroma, from 4th layer gist leiomyoma, and schwannoma ectopic pancreas and glomus tumor originated from 3rd and 4th layer
slide.notesHtml:
Leiomyoma originate from 2nd layer , From 3rd layer Lipoma Lymphangioma, fibroma, From 4th layer GIST Leiomyoma, and schwannoma

Ectopic pancreas and Glomus tumor originated from 3rd and 4th layer
slide.text: 4-Layer 2-Layer 3-Layer Brunnerioma Lympｈangioma Fibroma Cyst Leiomyoma GIST Leiomyoma Leiomyosarcoma Ectopic Pancreas Glomus Tumor How to diagnose SMT by originating layer Lipoma Carcinoid tumor Schwanｎoma Invasion

slide.title: Attention!!! You have to scan all area of the lesion
slide.titleNormalized: attention!!! you have to scan all area of the lesion
slide.notes: In order to evaluate the originating layer, you should scan all area of SMT, otherwise you may make misdiagnosis like this
slide.notesNormalized: in order to evaluate the originating layer, you should scan all area of smt, otherwise you may make misdiagnosis like this
slide.notesHtml: In order to evaluate the originating layer, you should scan all area of SMT, otherwise you may make misdiagnosis like this
slide.text: Attention!!! You have to scan all area of the lesion

slide.title: How to diagnose SMT by echo level
slide.titleNormalized: how to diagnose smt by echo level
slide.notes: Cyst Lymphangioma looks Anechoic , Lipoma looks hyperwchoic and another are in between
slide.notesNormalized: cyst lymphangioma looks anechoic , lipoma looks hyperwchoic and another are in between
slide.notesHtml: Cyst Lymphangioma looks Anechoic , Lipoma looks hyperwchoic and another are in between
slide.text: Hyperechoic (sm) Anechoic (Fluid) Hypoechoic (pm) Isoechoic (Liver & Spleen) Fibroma Cyst Lipoma GIST Leiomyosarcoma Ectopic Pancreas Glomus Tumor Lymphangioma Leiomyoma Schwannoma Brunnerioma Carcinoid tumor How to diagnose SMT by echo level

slide.title: Lipoma is detected as hyperechoic tumor
slide.titleNormalized: lipoma is detected as hyperechoic tumor
slide.text: Lipoma is detected as hyperechoic tumor

slide.title: Lymphangioma is hypoechoic and originated from 3rd layer
slide.titleNormalized: lymphangioma is hypoechoic and originated from 3rd layer
slide.text: Lymphangioma is hypoechoic and originated from 3rd layer

slide.title: Ectopic Pancreas
slide.text: Ectopic Pancreas Originate from 3rd & 4th layer (thickening of 4th layer) And hypoechoic

slide.title: Which one is the GIST ?
slide.text: Which one is the GIST ?

slide.title: Leiomyoma GIST Schwanoma
slide.text: Leiomyoma GIST Schwanoma Using EUS, it is almost impossible to diagnose SMT originated from 4th layer Then we have to obtain tissue from these SMTs by means of EUS-FNA.

slide.title: Malignant scoring system for SMT originated from 4th layer
slide.titleNormalized: malignant scoring system for smt originated from 4th layer
slide.text: Malignant scoring system for SMT originated from 4th layer ① ≧３cm ② Ｎｏｄｕｌｌａｒ ③ Ｈｅｔｅｒｏｇｅｎｕｏｕｓ ④ Ａｎｅｃｈｏｉｃ ａｒｅａ ⑤ Ｕｌｃｅｒａｔｉｏｎ Sensitivity 100% Specificity 51 - 74% SMT with 3 or more findings suspected to be malignant Yamada, Kida et al DEN 1992

slide.text: EUS-FNA Specimen HE αSMA Other immunostain: Desmin (-), c-kit (-), CD34 (-), S-100 (-)

slide.title: Optimal Puncture Route of EUS-FNA for SMT
slide.titleNormalized: optimal puncture route of eus-fna for smt
slide.notes: SMT is movable therefore you should puncture center or below of the tumor
slide.notesNormalized: smt is movable therefore you should puncture center or below of the tumor
slide.notesHtml: SMT is movable therefore you should puncture center or below of the tumor
slide.text: × 〇 △ Optimal Puncture Route of EUS-FNA for SMT

slide.title: Food attached Forward viewing Echoendoscope for SMT
slide.titleNormalized: food attached forward viewing echoendoscope for smt
slide.notes: In case of EUS-FNA of SMT especially small one, It is very useful to perform EUS-FNA with food attached forward-viewing echo endoscope
slide.notesNormalized: in case of eus-fna of smt especially small one, it is very useful to perform eus-fna with food attached forward-viewing echo endoscope
slide.notesHtml: In case of EUS-FNA of SMT especially small one, It is very useful to perform EUS-FNA with food attached forward-viewing echo endoscope
slide.text: Food attached Forward viewing Echoendoscope for SMT

slide.title: EUS-FNA for SMT with Foward-viewing Echoendoscope
slide.titleNormalized: eus-fna for smt with foward-viewing echoendoscope
slide.text: EUS-FNA for SMT with Foward-viewing Echoendoscope Forward

slide.title: Sampling and accuracy rate of FV-ES
slide.titleNormalized: sampling and accuracy rate of fv-es
slide.notes: This is a table of sampling and accuracy rate of FV-ES. There were 4 incomplete cases in pancreatic tumor. Tumor did not detected in 2 cases in pancreatic head and vessels could not be avoided also in two cases. The sampling rate and accuracy rate for subelpithelial tumor were almost the same as the conventional OV-ES. We could not show the advantage of attaching a transient hood to fix the target. There were one adverse event of spurting bleeding in gastric GIST case.
slide.notesNormalized: this is a table of sampling and accuracy rate of fv-es. there were 4 incomplete cases in pancreatic tumor. tumor did not detected in 2 cases in pancreatic head and vessels could not be avoided also in two cases. the sampling rate and accuracy rate for subelpithelial tumor were almost the same as the conventional ov-es. we could not show the advantage of attaching a transient hood to fix the target. there were one adverse event of spurting bleeding in gastric gist case.
slide.notesHtml:
This is a table of sampling and accuracy rate of FV-ES. There were 4 incomplete cases in pancreatic tumor. Tumor did not detected in 2 cases in pancreatic head and vessels could not be avoided also in two cases. The sampling rate and accuracy rate for subelpithelial tumor were almost the same as the conventional OV-ES. We could not show the advantage of attaching a transient hood to fix the target.

There were one adverse event of spurting bleeding in gastric GIST case.
slide.text:
Sampling rate Accuracy rate Pancreatic tumor （n=36） 80.6%（29/36)* 84.3%（27/32） Submucosal tumor （n=34） 82.4%（28/34） 73.5%（25/34） Lymph adenopathy （n=10） 90%（9/10） 90%（9/10） Others （n=7）
85.7%（6/7） 57.1%（4/7） Sampling and accuracy rate of FV-ES Adverse event bleeding 1.1% （1/87） Incomplete cases* tumor is undetected 5.6% (2/36) vessel is unavoidable 5.6% (2/36) Retroperitneal tumor 4, Gastric tumor 2, Biliary tumor 1 Our data 2016

slide.title: Patient and characteristics of SMT
slide.notes: This is a table of sampling and accuracy rate of FV-ES. There were 4 incomplete cases in pancreatic tumor. Tumor did not detected in 2 cases in pancreatic head and vessels could not be avoided also in two cases. Except those, Accuracy rate was 84.3%. The sampling rate and accuracy rate for subelpithelial tumor were almost the same as the conventional OV-ES. We could not show the advantage of attaching a transient hood to fix the target. There were one adverse event of spurting bleeding in gastric GIST case.
slide.notesNormalized: this is a table of sampling and accuracy rate of fv-es. there were 4 incomplete cases in pancreatic tumor. tumor did not detected in 2 cases in pancreatic head and vessels could not be avoided also in two cases. except those, accuracy rate was 84.3%. the sampling rate and accuracy rate for subelpithelial tumor were almost the same as the conventional ov-es. we could not show the advantage of attaching a transient hood to fix the target. there were one adverse event of spurting bleeding in gastric gist case.
slide.notesHtml:
This is a table of sampling and accuracy rate of FV-ES. There were 4 incomplete cases in pancreatic tumor. Tumor did not detected in 2 cases in pancreatic head and vessels could not be avoided also in two cases. Except those, Accuracy rate was 84.3%. The sampling rate and accuracy rate for subelpithelial tumor were almost the same as the conventional OV-ES. We could not show the advantage of attaching a transient hood to fix the target.

There were one adverse event of spurting bleeding in gastric GIST case.

slide.title: Adequate Sampling Rate for Subepithelial Tumor with Conventional Oblique or Forward-viewing Echoendoscope
slide.titleNormalized: adequate sampling rate for subepithelial tumor with conventional oblique or forward-viewing echoendoscope
slide.notes: According to the literature, This slide shows sampling rate of SMT by means of Oblique and forward viewing echoendoscope We can not compare these data directly, however forward viewing suspect to be better

We can not compare these data directly, however forward viewing suspect to be better
slide.text: Adequate Sampling Rate for Subepithelial Tumor with Conventional Oblique or Forward-viewing Echoendoscope

slide.title: RCT of Forward- vs Oblique-viewing Echoendoscope for Diagnosing Submucosal Tumor
slide.titleNormalized: rct of forward- vs oblique-viewing echoendoscope for diagnosing submucosal tumor
slide.notes: There is only one randomized study between Olique and forward viewing echoendoscope Dx accuracy is of the same, however tissue sampling size procedure time is superior with forward viewing echoendoiscope
slide.notesNormalized: there is only one randomized study between olique and forward viewing echoendoscope dx accuracy is of the same, however tissue sampling size procedure time is superior with forward viewing echoendoiscope
slide.notesHtml:
There is only one randomized study between Olique and forward viewing echoendoscope

Dx accuracy is of the same, however tissue sampling size procedure time is superior with forward viewing echoendoiscope
slide.text: Forward-V Oblique-V P value Dx yield for Total (%) 33/41 (80.5) 30/41 (73.2) 0.453 Dx for < 20 mm (%) 12/15 (80.0) 11/15 (73.3) 1.000 Dx Accuracy (%) 17/22 (77.2) 16/22 (72.7) 1.000 Tissue sample area ㎟ 2.46 (0.908-8.095) 1.00 (0.477-4.764) 0.046 No of Passes (IQR) 2 (2-3) 2 (1-3) 0.21 Procedure time (IQR) min 21 (15-30) 27 (17-35) 0.009 Procedure time 19G min 17 (13-31) 25 (16-33) 0.004 RCT of Forward- vs Oblique-viewing Echoendoscope for Diagnosing Submucosal Tumor Matsuzaki et al: GIE, 82;287, 2015
